children.text: The wall/roof sarking is visible in this area, which looks poorly finished, and may allow water and pest ingress.
Performance requirement 2.2.2 – Weatherproofing of the BCA states that

‘A roof and external wall (including openings around windows and doors) must prevent the penetration of water that could cause unhealthy or dangerous conditions, or loss of amenity for occupants; and undue dampness or deterioration of building elements’ .
Additionally, the Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances clause 6.01 Leaks in roofing, flashings and accessories states that

‘Roofing, including flashings and accessories, is defective if it leaks under normal weather conditions and is due to the builder’s workmanship, causes unhealthy or dangerous conditions, loss of amenity for occupants, undue dampness or deterioration of building elements’ .
The builder warrants that the work will be carried out in
, which is not the case in this area, and should be rectified.
